definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: First we decorate the walls with cut papers all red and bright.
sentences.chinese: 我们先要把墙上贴上鲜亮的红窗花。

sentences.english: Some house's windows are sticked on red paper cutlings.
sentences.chinese: 一些房屋的窗户都被贴上红色的窗花。

sentences.english: Other forms of paper cut are derived from the "window blossoms".
sentences.chinese: 其他的剪纸形式都是在窗花的基础上发展演变而来。

sentences.english: Window blossoms can be designed with irregular patterns.
sentences.chinese: 窗花可以不用很规则的设计。

sentences.english: Yuxian formerly paper -cut window, a Chinese folk paper -cut of the fine arts.
sentences.chinese: 蔚县剪纸原名窗花，属中国民间剪纸艺术中的精品。

sentences.english: Wei County Paper-cut, originally called window decoration, is the artistic treasure of Chinese folk Paper-cut.
sentences.chinese: 蔚县剪纸原名窗花，属中国民间剪纸艺术中的精品。

definition: papercutting (Chinese folk art)/to make paper cutouts
Spring Festival couplet (the first line of which is pasted on the right side of a doorway at New Year, and the second on the left side)
colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
gold and silver foil/gold and silver leaf
frost forming a pattern on a surface/rime
lintel (of a door)/fig. family's social status
